</FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="do79305_appendix_c_amended_and__do702385"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_do79305_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>  APPENDIX C    <BR>    <BR>    AMENDED AND RESTATED EMPLOYEE STOCK OPTION PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Purpose  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Purpose of this stock option plan ("Plan") is to encourage ownership of common shares (the&nbsp;"Shares") of Agnico-Eagle Mines Limited
(the&nbsp;"Corporation") by directors, officers, employees and service providers being those persons who are primarily responsible for the management and profitable growth of the Corporation's
business, by providing additional incentive for superior performance by such persons and to enable the Corporation to attract and retain valued directors, officers, employees and service providers. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interpretation  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the purpose of this Plan, the following terms shall have the following meanings: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Black Out Period</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any period during which a policy of the Corporation prevents an insider of the Corporation from trading in the&nbsp;Shares; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Committee</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Compensation Committee appointed by the Board of Directors of the Corporation; </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Consultant</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means an individual (including an individual whose services are contracted through a personal holding corporation) engaged to provide
ongoing management or consulting services for the Corporation or a subsidiary of the Corporation; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Eligible Assignee</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, in respect of any Eligible Person, such person's Spouse, minor children and minor grandchildren, a trust governed by a
registered retirement savings plan of an Eligible Person, an Eligible Corporation or an Eligible Family&nbsp;Trust; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Eligible Corporation</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a corporation controlled by an Eligible Person and of which all other shareholders are Eligible Assignees; </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Eligible Family Trust</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a trust of which the Eligible Person is a trustee and of which all beneficiaries are Eligible Assignees; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Eligible Person</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, subject to all applicable laws, any employee, officer, director of or Consultant to the Corporation or any subsidiary of the
Corporation; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Market Price</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall have the following meaning: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Market Price</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>", in respect of options to be granted with an Exercise Price denominated in Canadian dollars,
shall mean, at any date, the closing sale price for board lots of the Shares on the TSX on such day. If the Shares did not trade on the TSX on such day, Market Price shall be the closing sale price
for board lots of the Shares on the NYSE on such day converted into Canadian dollars at the rate at which United&nbsp;States dollars may be exchanged into Canadian dollars using the inverse Noon
Buying Rate. If the Shares did not trade on the TSX or NYSE on such day, Market Price shall be the closing sale price for board lots of the Shares on such stock exchange in Canada on which the Shares
are listed on such day as may be selected by the Committee for such purpose. If the Shares do not trade on such day on any such stock exchange, the Market Price shall be the average of the bid and ask
prices for board lots of the Shares at the close of trading on the TSX on such date;&nbsp;or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Market Price</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>", in respect of options to be granted with an Exercise Price denominated in
United&nbsp;States dollars, shall mean, at any date, the closing sale price for board lots of the Shares on the NYSE on such day. If the Shares did not trade on the NYSE on such day, Market Price
shall be the closing sale price for board lots of the Shares on the TSX on such day converted into United&nbsp;States dollars at the rate at which Canadian dollars may be exchanged into
United&nbsp;States dollars using the Noon Buying Rate. If the Shares do not trade on such day on either such stock exchange, the Market Price shall be the average of the bid and ask prices for board
lots of the Shares at the close of trading on the NYSE on such&nbsp;day. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>C-1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=38,EFW="2197667",CP="AGNICO-EAGLE MINES LIMITED",DN="2",CHK=264760,FOLIO='C-1',FILE='DISK124:[10ZAH5.10ZAH79305]DO79305A.;5',USER='NSCHUMA',CD='26-MAR-2010;00:54' -->
<A NAME="page_do79305_1_2"> </A>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
such Shares are not listed and posted for trading on any stock exchange, the Market Price in respect thereof shall be the fair market value of such Shares as determined by the
Committee in its sole discretion; </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Non-Management Eligible Person</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall have the meaning ascribed thereto in section&nbsp;8; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Noon Buying Rate</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the noon buying rate in the City of New&nbsp;York for cable transfers in Canadian dollars as certified for customs purposes
by the Federal Reserve Bank of New&nbsp;York, or, in the event such rate is not quoted or published by the Federal Reserve Bank of New&nbsp;York, shall be the exchange rate determined by reference
to such other publicly available service for displaying exchange rates as may be determined by the&nbsp;Committee; </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NYSE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the New&nbsp;York Stock Exchange; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>OBCA</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Business Corporations Act</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (Ontario), as amended from time to&nbsp;time; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Outstanding Issue</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the number of Shares outstanding on a non-diluted basis; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Spouse</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall have the meaning given to it in the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Income Tax&nbsp;Act</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (Canada); </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>subsidiary</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall have the meaning given to it in the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Securities Act</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (Ontario);&nbsp;and </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>TSX</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means The Toronto Stock Exchange. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Administration  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan shall be administered by the Committee, which shall consist of not fewer than three directors of the Corporation. Vacancies on the Committee, howsoever
caused, shall be filed by the Board of Directors of the Corporation. The Committee shall have full authority to interpret the Plan and to make any such rules and regulations and establish such
procedures as it deems appropriate for the administration of the Plan, taking into consideration the recommendations of management. The decisions of the Committee shall be binding and conclusive for
all purposes and upon all&nbsp;persons. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Number of Shares Reserved  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum number of Shares which may be reserved for issuance under the Plan shall be 22,000,000&nbsp;Shares, subject to adjustment in accordance with
section&nbsp;10 which number may only be increased with the approval of the shareholders of the Corporation. The maximum number of Shares which may be reserved for issuance to any one person
pursuant to options (under the Plan or otherwise), warrants, share purchase plans or other compensation arrangements shall: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>not
exceed 5% of the Outstanding Issue. Any Shares subject to an option granted under the Plan which for any reason is cancelled or terminated without
having been exercised shall again be available to be granted under the Plan. All Shares issued pursuant to the exercise of options granted under the Plan will be so issued as fully paid common shares
of the Corporation;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>notwithstanding
section&nbsp;4(a), the maximum number of Shares which may be reserved for issuance to any one non-executive director pursuant
to options (under the Plan or otherwise), warrants, share purchase plans or other compensation arrangements shall not exceed the lesser&nbsp;of:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>1%
of the Outstanding Issue; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>an
annual equity award value of $100,000 per such non-executive director; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>Notwithstanding
section&nbsp;4(a),
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>the
number of Shares which may be reserved for issuance to insiders of the Corporation pursuant to options (under the Plan or otherwise), warrants, share
purchase plans or other compensation arrangements, at any time, cannot exceed 10% of Outstanding Issue;&nbsp;and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>the
number of Shares issued to insiders of the Corporation pursuant to options (under the Plan or otherwise), warrants, share purchase plans or other
compensation arrangements, within any one&nbsp;year period, cannot exceed 10% of the Outstanding&nbsp;Issue. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>C-2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=39,EFW="2197667",CP="AGNICO-EAGLE MINES LIMITED",DN="2",CHK=887792,FOLIO='C-2',FILE='DISK124:[10ZAH5.10ZAH79305]DO79305A.;5',USER='NSCHUMA',CD='26-MAR-2010;00:54' -->
<A NAME="page_do79305_1_3"> </A>


<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Expiry Date  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Options granted under the Plan must expire not later than five years after the date the option was granted. Each option shall be subject to earlier termination as
provided in paragraph&nbsp;7(d) of the&nbsp;Plan. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participation  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Options shall be granted under the Plan only to Eligible Persons as shall be designated from time to time by the Committee, Eligible Corporations and Eligible
Family Trusts and shall be subject to the rules and regulations of any stock exchange upon which the Shares are listed for&nbsp;trading. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Terms and Conditions of Options  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The terms and conditions of options granted under the Plan shall be set forth in written option agreements between the Corporation and the optionees. Such terms
and conditions shall include the following and such
other provisions, not inconsistent with the Plan, as may be deemed advisable by the&nbsp;Committee: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exercise Price:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The exercise price of an option granted under the Plan shall be fixed by the
Committee which price shall not be less than the Market Price of the Shares on the trading day immediately preceding the date of the grant. The Committee may also determine that the exercise price per
Share may escalate at a specified rate dependent upon the year in which any option to purchase Shares may be exercised by the&nbsp;optionee.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Payment:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The full purchase price of Shares purchased under the option shall be paid in cash
upon the exercise thereof in the currency in which the Exercise Price is denominated. A holder of an option shall have none of the rights of a shareholder until the Shares are issued to him
or&nbsp;her.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exercise of Options:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee may determine when an option will become exercisable and may
determine that the option shall be exercisable in installments on such terms as to timing of vesting or otherwise as the Committee deems advisable provided that options granted under the Plan shall
vest not more quickly than, in equal installments (computed in each case to the nearest full share), on each of the date of grant of the Option and each anniversary of the date of grant of the Option
up to and including the second last anniversary date of the grant. Except as provided in paragraph&nbsp;7(d) hereof, no option may be exercised unless that optionee is then an Eligible Person. The
Plan shall not confer upon the optionee any right with respect to continuation of employment by the Corporation.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Termination of Options:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any option granted pursuant hereto, to the extent not validly
exercised, will terminate on the earliest of the following dates:
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>the
date of expiration specified in the option agreement, being not later than five years after the date the option was&nbsp;granted;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>subject
to subparagraph&nbsp;(d)(iv) below, 30&nbsp;days after the date an optionee ceases to be an Eligible Person for any reason whatsoever other
than&nbsp;death;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>twelve
months after the date of the optionee's death during which period the option may be exercised only by the optionee's legal representative or the
person or persons to whom the deceased optionee's rights under the option shall pass by will or the applicable laws of descent and distribution, and only to the extent that the optionee would have
been entitled to exercise it at the time of his death;&nbsp;and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iv)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>where
the optionee is a director of the Corporation and ceases to be an Eligible Person by reason of his or her retirement or resignation from the Board of
Directors of the Corporation, four years from the date of such retirement or resignation, subject to any resolution that may be passed by the Board of Directors of the Corporation on the
recommendation of the Committee shortening such term, and provided that in no event shall any option granted pursuant hereto expire later than five years after the date the option was&nbsp;granted.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(e)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Assignment to Eligible Assignees:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to obtaining approval in advance from the Corporation
and from each stock exchange on which shares of the Corporation are listed and which reserves the right to approve such assignments, Eligible Persons may assign options granted to them under the Plan
to </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>C-3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=40,EFW="2197667",CP="AGNICO-EAGLE MINES LIMITED",DN="2",CHK=422581,FOLIO='C-3',FILE='DISK124:[10ZAH5.10ZAH79305]DO79305A.;5',USER='NSCHUMA',CD='26-MAR-2010;00:54' -->
<A NAME="page_do79305_1_4"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>Eligible
Assignees and Eligible Assignees may, in turn, assign such options to other Eligible Assignees or the original optionee. The original optionee under the Plan must be an Eligible Person at the
time of the assignment. Notwithstanding any such assignment, all options granted under the Plan shall be deemed to be the option of the original optionee for the purposes of applying the rules and
policies of the stock exchanges on which shares of the Corporation are listed. No consideration may be given to any assignee in connection with any assignment of options granted under the Plan.
Subject to the foregoing, no options shall be transferable by the optionee other than by will or the laws of descent and distribution and shall be exercisable during the optionee's lifetime only by
him or&nbsp;her.  </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(f)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Applicable Laws or Regulations:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Corporation's obligation to sell and deliver Shares under
each option is subject to the compliance by the Corporation and any optionee with applicable securities laws and the requirements of regulatory authorities having jurisdiction and is also subject to
the acceptance for listing of the Shares which may be issued in exercise thereof by each stock exchange upon which Shares of the Corporation are listed for&nbsp;trading.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(g)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Maximum Number of Options Granted Per Fiscal Year:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum number of options which may be
granted under the Plan in any fiscal year of the Corporation may not exceed 2% of the Outstanding Issue immediately prior to the grant of such&nbsp;options. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Loans to Non-Management Eligible Persons  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to Section&nbsp;20 of the OBCA or any successor or similar legislation and other applicable laws, the Corporation may, at any time and from time to
time, lend money (on&nbsp;a non-recourse or limited recourse basis or otherwise) or provide guarantees or other support arrangements to assist an Eligible Person who is not a director or
officer of the Corporation (a&nbsp;"Non-Management Eligible Person") to fund all or a part of the purchase price for Shares being purchased pursuant to an option granted to a
Non-Management Eligible Person under the Plan on such terms and conditions as the Corporation may determine, provided that each loan made to such Non-Management Eligible Person
shall become due and payable in full on the date a Non-Management Eligible Person becomes a director or officer of the Corporation. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compulsory Acquisition or Going Private Transaction  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If and whenever there shall be a compulsory acquisition of the Shares of the Corporation following a takeover bid or issuer bid pursuant to Part&nbsp;XV of the
OBCA or any successor or similar legislation, then following the date upon which the takeover bid or issuer bid expires, an optionee shall be entitled to receive, and shall accept, for the same
exercise price, in lieu of the number of Shares to which such optionee was theretofore entitled to purchase upon the exercise of his or her options, the aggregate amount of cash, shares, other
securities or other property which such optionee would have been entitled to receive as a result of such bid if he or she had tendered such number of Shares to this&nbsp;bidder. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain Adjustments  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>of
any change in the Shares through subdivision, consolidation, reclassification, amalgamation, merger or&nbsp;otherwise;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>of
any stock dividend to holders of Shares;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>that
any rights are granted to all holders of Shares to purchase Shares at prices substantially below fair market&nbsp;value;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>of
any distribution of evidences of indebtedness or assets of the Corporation (excluding dividends paid in the ordinary course) to all holders of
Shares;&nbsp;or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(e)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>that
as a result of any recapitalization, merger, consolidation or otherwise, the Shares are converted into or exchangeable for any other securities; </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>C-4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=41,EFW="2197667",CP="AGNICO-EAGLE MINES LIMITED",DN="2",CHK=966458,FOLIO='C-4',FILE='DISK124:[10ZAH5.10ZAH79305]DO79305A.;5',USER='NSCHUMA',CD='26-MAR-2010;00:54' -->
<A NAME="page_do79305_1_5"> </A>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>then
in any such case, subject to prior approval of the relevant stock exchanges, the number or kind of shares reserved for issuance and available for options under the Plan, the number or kind of
shares subject to outstanding options and the exercise price per option shall be proportionally adjusted by the Committee to prevent substantial dilution or enlargement of the rights granted to, or
available for, holders of options as compared to holders of&nbsp;Shares. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Black Out Period  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything contained in the Plan or any option issued under the Plan, if the date on which an option expires occurs during, or within 10&nbsp;days
after the last day of a Black Out Period or other trading restriction imposed by the Corporation, in each case, that is applicable to the holder of the option, the date of termination or expiry of
such option will be the last day of that 10-day&nbsp;period. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B>12.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendment and Discontinuance of Plan  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>The
Board of Directors of the Corporation may, insofar as permitted by law and subject to any required approval of any stock exchange or other authority,
from time to time, without notice to or approval of the shareholders, amend or revise the terms of the Plan or discontinue the Plan at any time; provided, however, that no amendment or revisions may,
without the consent of the optionee, in any manner adversely affect the rights of the optionee under any option theretofore granted under the Plan. Examples of the types of amendments that the Board
of Directors of the Corporation may make without shareholder approval include, with limitation, the&nbsp;following:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>amendments
of a "housekeeping" nature, including any amendment for the purpose of curing any ambiguity, error or omission in the Plan or to correct or
supplement any provision of the Plan that is inconsistent with any other provision hereof;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>amendments
necessary to comply with applicable law, including, without limitation, the rules, regulations and policies of the&nbsp;TSX;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>amendments
respecting administration of the Plan;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iv)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>any
amendment to the vesting provisions of the Plan or any option issued under the Plan which does not entail an extension beyond the originally scheduled
expiry date for any such&nbsp;option;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(v)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>any
amendment to the early termination provisions of the Plan or any option issued under the plan, whether or not such option is held by an insider,
provided such amendment does not entail an extension beyond the originally scheduled expiry date for any such&nbsp;option;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(vi)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>the
addition or modification of a cashless exercise feature, payable in cash or common shares of the Corporation, which provides for a full deduction of
the number of underlying common shares from the Plan&nbsp;reserve;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(vii)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>amendments
necessary to suspend or terminate the Plan; or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(viii)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>any
other amendment, whether fundamental or otherwise, not described in this&nbsp;subsection
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>Notwithstanding
subsection&nbsp;(a), without approval of the shareholders, no amendment or revision&nbsp;shall:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>increase
the maximum number of Shares reserved for issuance under the Plan;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>reduce
the exercise price for any option;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>extend
the term of an option held by an insider of the Corporation;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iv)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>increase
any limit on grants of options to insiders of the Corporation set out in the&nbsp;Plan;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(v)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>amend
section&nbsp;7(e) or&nbsp;the definitions of "Eligible Assignee", "Eligible Corporation", "Eligible Family Trust" or "Eligible Person";
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(vi)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>amend
the participation limits in section&nbsp;4(b); or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(vii)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>grant
additional powers to the Board of Directors of the Corporation to amend the Plan or entitlements without the approval of&nbsp;shareholders </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>C-5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>

<UL>

</UL>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="dq79305_appendix_d_articles_of_amalgamation_resolution"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_dq79305_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>  APPENDIX D    <BR>    <BR>    ARTICLES OF AMALGAMATION RESOLUTION    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2><B> BE IT RESOLVED AS A SPECIAL RESOLUTION THAT:  </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>The
Articles of Amalgamation of the Company be amended by deleting "12" in the box setting out the maximum number of directors in item&nbsp;3 of the
Articles of Amalgamation and substituting it with&nbsp;"15";
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>The
board of directors of the Company is hereby authorized to set the number of the directors of the Company within the minimum and maximum numbers set out
in the Articles of Amalgamation of the Company;&nbsp;and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;text-align:justify"><FONT SIZE=2>Any
officer or director of the Company is authorized and directed on behalf of the Company to execute and deliver all such documents and to do all such acts
as may be necessary or desirable to give effect to this resolution. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>D-1</FONT></P>

<FONT SIZE=5><B>Management's Discussion and Analysis<BR>  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=4><B>(Prepared in accordance with United&nbsp;States GAAP)<BR>  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=5><B>for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> Agnico-Eagle Mines Limited<BR>
Management's Discussion and Analysis<BR>
Table of Contents  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="BG79302_TOC"></A> </FONT></P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_START_LINKTABLE -->

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="LEFT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT><BR></TH>
<TH style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Page </B></FONT></TH>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 style="font-family:times;"><p style="font-family:times;margin-left:10pt;text-indent:-10pt;"><FONT SIZE=2> </FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Executive Summary</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 style="font-family:times;"><p style="font-family:times;margin-left:10pt;text-indent:-10pt;"><FONT SIZE=2> </FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Strategy and Results</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 style="font-family:times;"><p style="font-family:times;margin-left:10pt;text-indent:-10pt;"><FONT SIZE=2> </FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Key Performance Drivers</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 style="font-family:times;"><p style="font-family:times;margin-left:10pt;text-indent:-10pt;"><FONT SIZE=2> </FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Results of Operations</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>7</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=0>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><p style="font-family:times;margin-left:10pt;text-indent:-10pt;"><FONT SIZE=2> </FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Revenues from Mining Operations</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>7</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=0>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><p style="font-family:times;margin-left:10pt;text-indent:-10pt;"><FONT SIZE=2> </FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Interest and Sundry Income</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>8</FONT></TD>
</TR>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
Management's Discussion and Analysis ("MD&amp;A") dated March&nbsp;26, 2010 of Agnico-Eagle Mines Limited ("Agnico-Eagle" or the "Company") should be read in conjunction with the
Company's Annual Audited Consolidated Financial Statements for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United&nbsp;States
("US&nbsp;GAAP"). All dollar amounts are presented in United&nbsp;States dollars ("US&nbsp;dollars", "$" or "US$"), unless otherwise specified. Certain information in this MD&amp;A is presented in
Canadian dollars ("C$") or European Union euros ("Euro" or
"&euro;"). Additional information relating to the Company, including the Company's Annual Report on Form&nbsp;20-F (the&nbsp;"Form&nbsp;20-F") for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, is available on the Canadian Securities Administrators' (the "CSA") SEDAR website at www.sedar.com. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>i</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>

<A NAME="page_bg79302_1_2"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="bg79302_note_to_investors_conc__bg702351"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>  NOTE TO INVESTORS CONCERNING FORWARD-LOOKING INFORMATION    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain statements in this MD&amp;A constitute "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of the United&nbsp;States Private
Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 and "forward-looking information" under the provisions of Canadian provincial securities laws and are referred to herein as "forward-looking statements". These
statements relate to, among other things, the Company's plans, objectives, expectations, estimates, beliefs, strategies and intentions and can generally be identified by the use of words such as
"anticipate", "believe", "budget", "could", "estimate", "expect", "forecast", "intend", "likely", "may", "plan", "project", "schedule", "should", "target", "will", "would" or other variations of these
terms or comparable terminology. Forward-looking statements and information in this report include, but are not limited to, statements relating to the Company's outlook for 2010 and future periods,
statements regarding future earnings, and the sensitivity of earnings to gold and other metal prices; anticipated trends for prices of gold and byproduct metals mined by the Company; estimates of
future mineral production and sales; estimates of future costs, including mining costs, total cash costs per ounce, minesite costs per tonne and other expenses; estimates of future capital
expenditure, exploration expenditure and other cash needs, and expectations as to the funding thereof; statements regarding the projected development of certain ore deposits, including estimates of
exploration, development and production and other capital costs and estimates of the timing of such development and production or decisions with respect to such development and production; estimates
of mineral reserves, mineral resources and ore grades and statements regarding anticipated future exploration results; estimates of cash flow; estimates of mine life; anticipated timing of events with
respect to the Company's minesites, mine construction projects and exploration projects; estimates of future costs and other liabilities for environmental remediation; statements regarding the
Company's expectations regarding the issuance of an aggregate of $600&nbsp;million of notes to institutional investors; and other anticipated trends with respect to the Company's capital resources
and results of&nbsp;operations. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Forward-looking
statements are necessarily based upon a number of factors and assumptions that, while considered reasonable by Agnico-Eagle as of the date of such statements, are
inherently subject to significant business, economic and competitive uncertainties and contingencies. The factors and assumptions of Agnico-Eagle upon which the forward-looking statements in this MD&amp;A
are based, and which may prove to be incorrect, include, but are not limited to, the assumptions set out in this MD&amp;A and the Form&nbsp;20-F as well as: that there are no significant
disruptions affecting Agnico-Eagle's operations, whether due to labour disruptions, supply disruptions, damage to equipment, natural occurrences, political changes, title issues or otherwise; that
permitting, development and expansion at each of Agnico-Eagle's mines and mine development projects proceeds on a basis consistent with current expectations, and that Agnico-Eagle does not change its
development plans relating to such projects; that the exchange rate between the Canadian dollar, Euro, Mexican peso and the US&nbsp;dollar will be approximately consistent with
current levels or as set out in this MD&amp;A and the Form&nbsp;20-F; that prices for gold, silver, zinc, copper and lead will be consistent with Agnico-Eagle's expectations; that prices for
key mining and construction supplies, including labour costs, remain consistent with Agnico-Eagle's current expectations; that production meets expectations; that Agnico-Eagle's current estimates of
mineral reserves, mineral resources, mineral grades and mineral recovery are accurate; that there are no material delays in the timing for completion of development projects; and that there are no
material variations in the current tax and regulatory environment that affect Agnico-Eagle. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
forward-looking statements in this MD&amp;A reflect the Company's views as at the date of this MD&amp;A and involve known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors which could cause
the actual results, performance or achievements of the Company or industry results to be materially different from any future results, performance or achievements expressed or implied by such
forward-looking statements. Such factors include, among others, the risk factors set forth in "Item&nbsp;3 Key Information&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Risk Factors" in the
Form&nbsp;20-F. Given these uncertainties, readers are cautioned not to place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements, which speak only as of the date made. Except as
otherwise required by law, the Company expressly disclaims any obligation or undertaking to release publicly any updates or revisions to any such statements to reflect any change in the Company's
expectations or any change in events, conditions or circumstances on which any such statement is based. This MD&amp;A contains information regarding anticipated total cash costs per ounce and minesite
costs per tonne at certain of the Company's mines and mine development projects. This information was developed to assist management with its assessment as to what resources to allocate to the </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>ii</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=3,EFW="2197667",CP="AGNICO-EAGLE MINES LIMITED",DN="3",CHK=413114,FOLIO='ii',FILE='DISK121:[10ZAH2.10ZAH79302]BG79302A.;30',USER='JDAY',CD='26-MAR-2010;15:03' -->
<A NAME="page_bg79302_1_3"> </A>
<BR>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>construction
and/or expansion of its mine and mine development projects. Investors are cautioned that this information may not be suitable for other&nbsp;purposes. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="bg79302_note_to_investors_conc__bg702518"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>  NOTE TO INVESTORS CONCERNING ESTIMATES OF MINERAL RESOURCES    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> Cautionary Note to Investors concerning estimates of Measured and Indicated Mineral Resources  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>This
document uses the terms "measured mineral resources" and "indicated mineral resources". Investors are advised that while those terms are recognized and required by Canadian regulations, the
U.S.&nbsp;Securities and Exchange Commission (the&nbsp;"SEC") does not recognize them. </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Investors are cautioned not to assume that any part or all of mineral deposits in
these categories will ever be converted into&nbsp;mineral reserves</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> Cautionary Note to Investors concerning estimates of Inferred Mineral Resources  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>This
document uses the term "inferred mineral resources". Investors are advised that while this term is recognized and required by Canadian regulations, the SEC does not recognize it. "Inferred
mineral resources" have a great amount of uncertainty as to their existence and great uncertainty as to their economic and legal feasibility. It cannot be assumed that all or any part of an inferred
mineral resource will ever be upgraded to a higher category. Under Canadian rules, estimates of inferred mineral resources may not form the basis of feasibility or pre-feasibility studies,
except in rare cases. </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Investors are cautioned not to assume that part or all of an inferred mineral resource exists, or is economically or legally
mineable</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="bg79302_note_to_investors_conc__bg702528"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>  NOTE TO INVESTORS CONCERNING CERTAIN MEASURES OF PERFORMANCE    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This MD&amp;A presents certain measures, including "total cash costs per ounce" and "minesite costs per tonne", that are not recognized
measures under US GAAP. This data may not be comparable to data presented by other gold producers. For a reconciliation of these measures to the figures presented in the consolidated financial
statements prepared in accordance with US GAAP see "Results of Operations&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Production Costs". The Company believes that these generally accepted industry
measures are realistic indicators of operating performance and are useful in allowing year over year comparisons. However, both of these non-US GAAP financial measures should be considered
together with other data prepared in accordance with US GAAP, and these measures, taken by themselves, are not necessarily indicative of operating costs or cash flow measures prepared in accordance
with US GAAP. This MD&amp;A also contains information as to estimated future total cash costs per ounce and minesite costs per tonne for projects under development. These estimates are based upon the
total cash costs per ounce and minesite costs per tonne that the Company expects to incur to mine gold at those projects and, consistent with the reconciliation provided, do not include production
costs attributable to accretion expense and other asset retirement costs, which will vary over time as each project is developed and mined. It is therefore not practicable to reconcile these
forward-looking non-US GAAP financial measures to the most comparable US GAAP&nbsp;measure. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>iii</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_dc79302_1_1"> </A>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"Black" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:times;" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"border-bottom:double #000000 2.25pt;" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"border-bottom:double #000000 2.25pt;margin-bottom:0pt;" -->


 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B> Executive Summary  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agnico-Eagle is a gold mining company with mining operations in northwestern Quebec, northern Mexico, northern Finland and Nunavut and
exploration activities in Canada, Europe, Latin America and the United&nbsp;States. Agnico-Eagle's LaRonde Mine in Quebec is one of Canada's largest operating gold mines by gold reserves and has
provided the Company's foundation for international expansion. Agnico-Eagle earns a significant proportion of its revenue and cash flow from the production and sale of gold in both dore bars and
concentrate form. The remainder of revenue and cash flow is generated by the production and sale of byproduct metals, namely silver, zinc, copper and&nbsp;lead. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agnico-Eagle's
production is low-cost, usually in the industry's lowest quartile, which protects shareholders during periods of weaker gold prices. Agnico-Eagle is positioned
to benefit from a stronger gold price and, throughout its 38-year history, Agnico-Eagle's policy has been not to sell forward its future gold production. In 2009, Agnico-Eagle achieved a
total cash costs per ounce of gold produced of $347 and an average realized price of gold of $1,024 per ounce, an increase of 16% over 2008's realized price of $879&nbsp;per&nbsp;ounce. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
the past year, Agnico-Eagle has gone from operating two gold mines in Canada to being a multi-national gold mining company operating a total of five gold mines. Each mine is located
in a politically stable area that the Company believes is supportive of the mining industry. The political stability of the regions in which Agnico-Eagle operates helps to provide confidence in its
current and future prospects and profitability. This is an important quality for Agnico-Eagle as it believes each one of the projects has long-term mining camp&nbsp;potential. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I> Key Success Factors  </I></B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company achieved record gold production in 2009. Three new mines achieved commercial production in 2009 and one new
mine is expected to achieve commercial production in the first quarter of 2010. Production from these mines is expected to increase to projected rates as operations reach steady-state levels. </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>At year-end 2009, gold reserves increased 2%, including replacement of gold mined, as compared to
December&nbsp;31, 2008 to 18.4&nbsp;million ounces through exploration on existing properties.  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Operations are located in mining-friendly regions with low political risk and long-term mining
camp&nbsp;potential.  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company's total cash costs per ounce are believed to be in the lowest quartile in the gold industry; total cash costs
per ounce of gold in 2009 were&nbsp;$347.  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company declared a dividend of $0.18 per share, its 28<SUP>th</SUP>&nbsp;consecutive annual cash&nbsp;dividend. </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company's longstanding policy not to sell forward its future gold production ensures that shareholders always
participate fully in rising gold prices; in 2009, the Company benefited from an increase of 16% in realized gold prices in 2009 over 2008&nbsp;levels.  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company maintains a solid financial position, as it is fully funded for its currently planned growth, and maintains a
low number of shares outstanding relative to its peers, putting it in a strong position to continue to build per share&nbsp;value.  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company has strong senior management continuity as the chief executive officer and the chief operating officer have
25&nbsp;years of service with the Company and were previously named Mining Men of the Year by the Northern Miner Newspaper. The Company's chief financial officer was named Canada's CFO of the
Year&#153; in 2009 by Financial Executives International Canada.  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Agnico-Eagle was named Nunavut Mining Company of the Year at the 2009 Nunavut Mining Symposium. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><I> Quebec, Canada  </I></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Throughout 2009, the Company continued executing its strategy of building a multi-mine platform from the foundation of its
LaRonde Mine and Goldex Mine in Quebec, Canada, with the commencement of mining operations at the nearby Lapa&nbsp;Mine and the continuation of construction of the extension of existing </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=5,EFW="2197667",CP="AGNICO-EAGLE MINES LIMITED",DN="3",CHK=605865,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK121:[10ZAH2.10ZAH79302]DC79302A.;21',USER='JDAY',CD='26-MAR-2010;15:04' -->
<A NAME="page_dc79302_1_2"> </A>
<BR>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>infrastructure
below Level&nbsp;245 at the LaRonde mine, referred to as the LaRonde mine extension, which is anticipated to extend the mine life through 2022. The infrastructure base at, and
knowledge gained building, the LaRonde Mine has been leveraged by the Company in building and operating the Goldex Mine and the Lapa Mine, both of which are within 60&nbsp;kilometres of the LaRonde
Mine. The Goldex Mine achieved commercial production in August&nbsp;2008 and the Lapa Mine achieved commercial production in May&nbsp;2009. These three Quebec mines, with a total of
7.3&nbsp;million ounces of gold reserves, benefit from common infrastructure and mining team and are expected to continue to increase the Company's production profile. The LaRonde Mine extension is
expected to increase production from that mine with gold production expected to average 320,000&nbsp;ounces annually for the remainder of its mine life, while the Goldex Mine and the Lapa Mine are
anticipated to produce 175,000 and 115,000&nbsp;ounces of gold annually, respectively, when running at designed capacity. As a result of a positive scoping study completed in July&nbsp;2009, the
Company determined to expand mining and milling operations at the Goldex Mine to 8,000&nbsp;tonnes per day. Completion of the project is anticipated to be in late 2010. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><I> Finland  </I></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2006, the Company began construction on the Kittila Mine in northern Finland. This property was added to the Company's portfolio
through the acquisition of Riddarhyttan Resources AB in 2005. This property was attractive to the Company as northern Finland is geologically
similar to the Abitibi region of Quebec, where the LaRonde Mine is located, and has excellent infrastructure in the surrounding region. In addition, the Kittila Mine is situated in what the Company
believes to be a politically stable area that is supportive of the mining industry. Using the Company's technical experience gained from its operations in Quebec, the team designed a drilling program
at Kittila which led to the conversion of mineral resources to mineral reserves at the beginning of 2006. A positive feasibility study completed in mid-2006 led to the Company's decision
to build the Kittila&nbsp;Mine. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Construction
was completed in 2008 and the commissioning of the mill commenced in late 2008. Commercial production was achieved in May&nbsp;2009. A total of 71,838&nbsp;ounces of
gold were produced in 2009, including 65,571&nbsp;commercial production ounces of gold. The Kittila Mine is estimated to produce an average of 150,000&nbsp;ounces of gold annually for the
remainder of its mine&nbsp;life. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
addition, the 2009 exploration program resulted in an additional 0.8&nbsp;million ounces of mineral reserves in 2009. The Company believes the Kittila Mine has potential to grow as,
in addition to the total mineral reserves of 4.0&nbsp;million ounces of gold, the deposit continues to be open at depth and along strike. A scoping study is underway to assess the feasibility of
doubling operations to 6,000&nbsp;tonnes per day. This would involve sinking a shaft and expanding the Kittila mill. The study is expected to be completed in early&nbsp;2011. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><I> Mexico  </I></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2006, the Company completed the acquisition of the Pinos Altos property, an advanced stage exploration property in northern Mexico,
after the Company's extensive drilling campaign had doubled the contained gold and silver resources. In August&nbsp;2007, a favourable feasibility study led to the decision to build the Pinos Altos
Mine, with construction ending in 2009 and commercial production achieved in November&nbsp;2009. A total of 16,189&nbsp;ounces of gold were produced in 2009, including 9,565&nbsp;commercial
production ounces of gold. The Pinos Altos Mine is estimated to produce an average of 165,000&nbsp;ounces of gold annually for the remainder of its mine&nbsp;life. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Pinos Altos Mine has total mineral reserves of 3.4&nbsp;million ounces of gold and 93.6&nbsp;million ounces of silver. Several areas of exploration upside, in combination with a
targeted exploration program in 2010, provides the Company with further potential of increasing mineral reserves at the Pinos Altos Mine. In 2009, the Company commenced the construction of a
stand-alone heap leach operation at the Creston Mascota deposit at the Pinos&nbsp;Altos Mine. The Creston Mascota operation's annual production and mineral reserves are included in the Pinos Altos
Mine data. The Creston Mascota deposit is approximately seven kilometres to the northwest of the main deposit at Pinos Altos. The 2009 exploration program identified the potential to develop
additional satellite deposits (Cubiro, Sinter and San Eligio) that will be the focus of the 2010 exploration program. In addition, Agnico-Eagle believes it is an employer of choice in the region with
its high-quality facilities, good community relations and local hiring and&nbsp;purchases. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=6,EFW="2197667",CP="AGNICO-EAGLE MINES LIMITED",DN="3",CHK=49269,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK121:[10ZAH2.10ZAH79302]DC79302A.;21',USER='JDAY',CD='26-MAR-2010;15:04' -->
<A NAME="page_dc79302_1_3"> </A>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><I> Nunavut, Canada  </I></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2007, the Company acquired Cumberland Resources&nbsp;Ltd., then owner of the Meadowbank gold project in Nunavut, Canada. This
transaction was consistent with the Company's strategy of building value by growing in mining-friendly, low political risk areas. The Company had its first dore bar pour at the Meadowbank Mine in
February&nbsp;2010 and anticipates commercial production will be achieved in the first quarter of&nbsp;2010 with an average of approximately 350,000&nbsp;ounces of gold per year to be produced
over the estimated life of the mine. The Company continues to apply the proven technical expertise gained at the LaRonde Mine, as the Meadowbank Mine is supervised by the Company's technical team
based in northwestern Quebec. The Meadowbank Mine's gold reserves increased by 0.1&nbsp;million ounces in 2009 to a total of 3.7&nbsp;million ounces with multiple areas of exploration upside
potential. A scoping study is currently underway to assess the feasibility of increasing the planned production rate from 8,500&nbsp;tonnes per day to 10,000&nbsp;tonnes per day by increasing the
mining rate from the existing pits and the southern deposit. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> Strategy and Results  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agnico-Eagle focuses on quality, growth and a strong financial position, while maintaining a safe workplace for employees, protecting
the environment and retaining full exposure to gold&nbsp;prices. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agnico-Eagle
believes it creates value for shareholders by growing gold production in regions it believes to have low political risk. The Company believes it can achieve its objective of
maximizing shareholder value while operating in an environmentally friendly manner in its international gold&nbsp;camps. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With
roots that go back more than 36&nbsp;years, the Company has sought to deliver on its vision by following a five pronged growth strategy that has successfully guided the Company
throughout 2009, even during a period of economic turmoil, to achieve record production&nbsp;results: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Produce
more gold  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Kittila Mine, Lapa Mine and Pinos Altos Mine all achieved commercial production in&nbsp;2009 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Record consolidated annual gold production of 492,972&nbsp;ounces in 2009, an increase of 78% over the
276,762&nbsp;ounces produced in&nbsp;2008  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Meadowbank Mine commissioning in progress at year-end with commercial production anticipated in the first
quarter of&nbsp;2010  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>LaRonde Mine extension proceeding on schedule  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Construction at the Creston Mascota deposit at Pinos Altos started in 2009  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Additional opportunities for internal growth continuously being evaluated
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Grow
gold reserves  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Gold reserves have increased year over year with a net increase of 2% in 2009, compared to year-end 2008, or
0.3&nbsp;million ounces to a record total of 18.4&nbsp;million&nbsp;ounces  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>This net increase in total gold reserves includes the replacement of the 0.5&nbsp;million ounces of gold produced
in&nbsp;2009  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>The Company believes several of its deposits are on track to exceed five&nbsp;million ounces of mineral reserves
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Acquire
small, think big  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Significant gold reserve and resource growth largely from prior acquisitions that adhered to the "acquire small, think
big"&nbsp;strategy  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Strategic investments made in several junior gold exploration companies in order to maintain a continuous pipeline of
potential growth opportunities
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Be
a low-cost leader  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Consolidated total cash costs per ounce of $347 that the Company believes ranks in the lowest quartile of
the&nbsp;industry  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Minesite costs per tonne targets achieved at both the LaRonde Mine and Goldex&nbsp;Mine
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Maintain
a solid financial position  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Available bank credit facilities increased 50% to $900&nbsp;million  </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Successful completion of two flow-through share offerings for total gross proceeds of $26&nbsp;million </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>2010 capital expenditure program fully funded </FONT></DD></DL>
